alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 11:44AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Henry and northeastern Houston Counties in southeastern Alabama, southwestern Calhoun and Early Counties in southwestern Georgia through 115 PM EDT/1215 PM CDT/... At 1244 PM EDT/1144 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Headland, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Headland, Blakely, Dothan, Kinsey, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia, Centerville, Gordon, Sigma, Grandberry Crossroads, Enon, Rock Hill, Barber, Pleasant Plains, Headland Municipal A/P, Early Co A/p, Farley Nuclear Plant and Smyrna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia.
